content:
I’m a senior undergrad in the Department of Electrical Engineering at Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IIT-M), India.
During the summer of 2019, I worked at the IRIS lab., USC under Prof. Ram Nevatia, where I explored decoupling attribute features from object features.

title: Varun Sundar

content:
Note: This blog post is meant to serve as a journal or a log of sorts of my learnings and reflections in a course I took up this semester (Fall 2019). It is not meant to be a reliable course transcript and as such might skim on some portions, while emphasising on others.
Modules covered under the course (to date):
 Search for purpose: Aug 1st, 2nd week Mindfulness and the power of habits _ Understanding your personality Decision making and critical thinking Effective communication  Search for Purpose In this introductory module, we began by discussing our expectations and aspirations from the course.
Ikigai is the Japanese concept of finidng a purpose in life. The philosphy revolves around the idea that once you discover your true, unwaivering purpose in life, the journey called life becomes much more meaningful. This practice historically originates from the
At the onset, this did not make much sense to me. Yes, goal making is important and is quite often stressed in many work-ethic related workshops. But there’s one caveat to goal making:

Mindfulness Time Management
Personal notes
Understanding your Personality
